Hi there,

If I want to use two objects together then it's easy of course to type in 'use acid [b:2gtp7w7j]with [/b:2gtp7w7j]shackles'.

But what if I wanted to allow the user to use the point-n-click interface to do this? 
I can't just use the 'use' verb because there's more than one object that my 'active' object could interact with. So how does one implement a menu choice for what the second object in the sentence is?
Posts.HTML:
Hi there,

If I want to use two objects together then it's easy of course to type in 'use acid with shackles'.

But what if I wanted to allow the user to use the point-n-click interface to do this?
I can't just use the 'use' verb because there's more than one object that my 'active' object could interact with. So how does one implement a menu choice for what the second object in the sentence is?

Posts.EditableText: This feature called 'two-object verbs' has been added in Quest 5.2. If you type 'use acid' it will ask 'with object?' Choose 'shackles.'
